marytts.htsengine

Class HTSVocoder

  • java.lang.Object
    • marytts.htsengine.HTSVocoder

  • public class HTSVocoder
extends Object
    Synthesis of speech out of speech parameters. Mixed excitation MLSA vocoder. Java port and extension of HTS engine API version 1.04 Extension: mixed excitation
    Author:
    Marcela Charfuelan

    • Method Detail

      • htsMLSAVocoder

        public AudioInputStream htsMLSAVocoder(HTSParameterGeneration pdf2par,
                              HMMData htsData)
                                throws Exception
        HTS_MLSA_Vocoder: Synthesis of speech out of mel-cepstral coefficients. This procedure uses the parameters generated in pdf2par stored in: PStream mceppst: Mel-cepstral coefficients PStream strpst : Filter bank stregths for mixed excitation PStream magpst : Fourier magnitudes PStream lf0pst : Log F0
        Throws:
        Exception

      • htsMLSAVocoderCommand

        public static void htsMLSAVocoderCommand(String[] args)
                                  throws IOException,
                                         InterruptedException,
                                         Exception
        Stand alone vocoder reading parameters from files in SPTK format, parameters in args[] array in the following order:

        The type of spectrum parameters is set through the parameters gamma and alpha

        Parameters:
        gamma - : 0
        alpha - : 0.45

        MGC: stage=gamma=0 alpha=0.42 linear gain

        LSP: gamma>0

        LSP : gamma=1 alpha=0.0

        Mel-LSP: gamma=1 alpha=0.42

        MGC-LSP: gamma=3 alpha=0.42

        useLoggain - : 0 (1:true 0:false)
        beta - : 0.0 0.0 --> 1.0 (postfiltering)
        rate - : 16000
        fperiod - : 80 (5 milisec)
        mcepFile - : filename
        mcepVsize - : vector size (75 if using a file from amain2 hmm voice training data, otherwise specify)
        lf0File - : filename
        lf0Vsize - : vector size (3 if using a file from a hmm voice training data, otherwise specify)
        outputfile - : filename The following are optional:

        if using mixed excitation:

        strFile - : filename
        strVsize - : vector size (15 if using a file from a hmm voice training data, it can be found in data/filters/mix_excitation_filters.txt, otherwise specify)
        filtersFile - : filename
        numFilters - : 5 (if using the filters file used in the HTS-MARY demo, otherwise specify)
        orderFilters - : 48 (if using the filters file used in the HTS-MARY demo, otherwise specify)

        if using Fourier magnitudes:

        magFile - : filename
        magVsize - : vector size (30 if using a file from a hmm voice training data, otherwise specify)

        example iput parameters:

        0 0.45 0 0.0 16000 80 cmu_us_arctic_slt_a0001.mgc 75 cmu_us_arctic_slt_a0001.lf0 3 vocoder_out.wav cmu_us_arctic_slt_a0001.str 15 mix_excitation_filters.txt 5 48 cmu_us_arctic_slt_a0001.mag 30

        example input parameters without mixed excitation:

        0 0.45 0 0.0 16000 80 cmu_us_arctic_slt_a0001.mgc 75 cmu_us_arctic_slt_a0001.lf0 3 vocoder_out.wav

        Throws:
        IOException
        InterruptedException
        Exception
